articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Art Performance by Itinerant Youth Art Squad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Enjoys Art Performance by Itinerant Youth Art Squad
Pyongyang, January 31 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il together with KPA servicepersons enjoyed an art performance given by the KPA itinerant youth art squad at the theatre of the renovated Hyangsan Hotel.
					 Put on the stage were colorful numbers of diverse genres including a male duet "Soldiers Live Near the General", a poem and story-telling  "Diary of the General's Forced March", serial songs "Country which Witnesses Dramatic Changes" and "It's Offensive", an agitation through drama "With Good Impression", a female folk solo "Our Army and Our People", an agitation and song "Push Back the Frontiers of Science", male quartet "The Country I Am Defending", agitation story-telling "Let Us Not Allow Leisure" and a poem and song "Let's Become the Seventh Regiment of Modern Type".  
					
					 The performers fully represented the invincible might of the heroic Korean People's Army which has grown to be a matchless army under the care of the great brilliant commander and the firm faith and will of the KPA servicepersons to devotedly defend the headquarters of the revolution and accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche with arms under the leadership of Kim Jong Il without fail. 
					
					 He expressed great satisfaction over the fact that they presented a splendid performance rich in its ideological contents and high in artistry with pieces truthfully reflecting the inexhaustible mental power, noble morality and virtues and worthwhile military service of the KPA service personnel.
					
					 Praising the performance as the best one of great cognitive and educational value among the recent performances, in particular, he highly appreciated the successful performance and extended thanks and commendation of the supreme commander to all the creators and artistes of the squad.
					
					 He advanced important tasks which would serve as guidelines for conducting revolutionary and militant performing activities.
					
					 Among the audience were KPA commanding officers including Generals Hyon Chol Hae and Ri Myong Su and senior officials of the WPK Central Committee including Department Director Kim Kyong Hui and First Vice Department Directors Ju Kyu Chang, Ri Je Gang, Ri Jae Il and Han Kwang Sang.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects Command of KPA Unit 630
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects Command of KPA Unit 630
 Pyongyang, January 31 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il inspected the command of KPA Large Combined Unit 630. 
					 He first looked round the room devoted to the history of the unit.
					
					 Recalling with deep emotion President Kim Il Sung's undying exploits associated with the history of the unit, he said that the wise leadership and meticulous care of the President helped it grow to be a strong large combined unit made up of combined units and other units of a-match-for-a hundred combatants.
					
					 He highly appreciated the unit's merits, saying that it has a history of laudable feats performed in the defence of the country and socialist construction.
					
					 After acquainting himself with the unit's performance of duty, he went round an operation study room and a lecture room on military affairs to learn about the training of commanding personnel.
					
					 Noting with appreciation that all the servicepersons of the unit have discharged their guard duty in a responsible manner, watching with high vigilance the enemy's moves for aggression, he advanced the important tasks that would serve as guidelines in increasing the combat capability of the unit in every way.
					
					 He also made rounds of a servicepersons' hall, a library and other entertainment and cultural facilities to learn in detail about how the political work is conducted among servicepersons.
					
					 Very pleased to hear that all the servicepersons of the unit have become avid readers in the course of devouring must books, he said: The revolutionary habit of reading established in the whole army is an unusual feature which can be found only in our army.
					
					 Then he went round a bedroom, a mess, a non-staple food store and other supply facilities to take warm care of servicepersons' living.
					
					 After learning about the management of the unit, he expressed great satisfaction over the fact that the unit has kept its interior and exterior neat and clean.
					
					 The unit is a model not only in the training but also in the politico-ideological work, the welfare supply service, the unit management and all other aspects, he said, highly praising it as an exemplary unit in the era of Songun which has thoroughly embodied in the work and life the slogan of the Party "Let us train, study and live like anti-Japanese guerrillas!"
					
					 He had a photo session with the servicepersons of the unit, expressing expectation and belief that they would creditably discharge their honorable mission as the pillar of the revolution and powerful driving force taking the lead in upholding the Songun leadership of the Party.
					
					 He was accompanied by KPA Generals Hyon Chol Hae and Ri Myong Su and other commanding officers of the army.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppets' War Moves Denounced
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppets' War Moves Denounced 
 Pyongyang, January 31 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification made public statements in denunciation of the reckless war moves and dictatorship of south Korean puppets.
					 The organization in its Jan. 27 statement accused the south Korean bellicose forces of escalating their war moves as evidenced by their recent extremely provocative outbursts calling for a "preemptive strike" and an "emergency ruling plan" worked out by them. The statement declared that all the people would launch nationwide actions to prevent a war and force the present regime to step down and implement the joint declarations.
					
					 It called for foiling the war moves of the bellicose forces and achieving national reunification as early as possible by the concerted efforts of the entire nation.
					
					 The HQ in its Jan. 26 statement chided the Grand National Party of south Korea for openly voicing opposition, putting politically motivated pressure on the court which recently passed the decision of "not guilty" upon Kang Ki Gap, representative of the Democratic Labor Party, members of the Teachers Union and PD pocketbook production team, etc.
					
					 Recalling that wicked gangsters of a conservative organization at a "news conference" cried out for "shooting a leftist judge to death without trial," the statement said, warning that they will not be able to escape the people's judgment as it is a tyrannical action ignoring the will of the people.

articles.title: Moves on "Alliance" with US Assailed
articles.content:
Moves on "Alliance" with US Assailed 
 Pyongyang, January 31 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea held the 97th meeting for peace and disarmament outside the "Ministry of National Defense" on Jan. 26 to denounce the U.S. and the south Korean bellicose forces' reckless moves to tighten "alliance" for aggression.
					 A letter of protest read out there accused the U.S. and the south Korean authorities of holding the 24th "meeting on security policy initiative" on Jan. 28 at which they contemplated mapping out "defense guidelines" the keynote of which is the reinforcement of the U.S. troops on the Korean Peninsula in case of "emergency" and the provision of conditions for the stable presence of the U.S. troops in south Korea, etc.
					
					 The letter said the "defense guidelines" are aimed to protect the interests of the U.S., implement its military strategy and step up the preparations for preemptive attack on the north.
					
					 It demanded an immediate halt to the reckless moves to tighten the "alliance" with the U.S.

articles.title: Indian Party Leader Meets DPRK Ambassador
articles.content:
Indian Party Leader Meets DPRK Ambassador
 Pyongyang, January 31 (KCNA) -- Debabrata Biswas, general secretary of the Central Committee of the All-India Forward Bloc, when meeting the DPRK ambassador to India on Jan. 25, hoped that the Korean people would achieve great successes in carrying out the militant tasks set forth in the joint New Year editorial under the wise leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 It is of very weighty significance that the DPRK set it as the general orientation to launch a sweeping campaign for bringing about a drastic turn in the improvement of the people's standard of living in the joint editorial this year, he said.
					
					 The WPK and the All-India Forward Bloc have maintained good relations, supporting and solidarizing with each other in the efforts for socialism against imperialism, he noted, expressing the unshakable will of the bloc to keep boosting such relations in the future. 
					
					 He stressed that the DPRK proposal for concluding a peace treaty is a positive step for peace, security and denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula, expressing full support for the proposal.

articles.title: DPRK FM Statement Supported in South Africa
articles.content:
DPRK FM Statement Supported in South Africa
Pyongyang, January 31 (KCNA) -- The South African Association of Friendship and Solidarity with Korean People and the Group for the Study of the Progressive Ideas of South Africa issued a joint statement on Jan. 23 in support of the statement of the DPRK Foreign Ministry. It urged the parties to the Armistice Agreement to take a sincere attitude toward the replacement of the AA with a peace treaty and make positive efforts for an early conclusion of a peace treaty in the interests of the Korean people.  
					 Expressing full support for the DPRK proposal for a peace treaty, the statement noted that replacing the AA with a peace treaty is prerequisite for peace in the Korean Peninsula and the rest of Northeast Asia at present. 
					
					 We consider the recent proposal of the DPRK Foreign Ministry as a vivid reflection of its sincere efforts for peace in the peninsula and the rest of the region, the statement said, stressing the need to start talks for a peace treaty and confidence between the DPRK and the U.S. as early as possible.

articles.title: Peace and Reunification of Korean Peninsula Supported in US
articles.content:
Peace and Reunification of Korean Peninsula Supported in US
 Pyongyang, January 31 (KCNA) -- A lecture on the conclusion of a peace treaty between the DPRK and the U.S. for peace and prosperity on the Korean Peninsula and other parts of Northeast Asia was held in the U.S. on January 23 under the sponsorship of the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. 
					 Present there were representatives of various organizations of Koreans in the U.S. including the federation and the U.S. Regional Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration and other social activists.
					
					 Speakers at the lecture asserted that in order to bring peace and prosperity to Northeast Asia including the peninsula it is necessary to put an end to the hostile relations between the DPRK and the U.S. and replace the Armistice Agreement by a peace treaty.
					
					 What is most important for settling the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula is for the U.S. to roll back its policy to isolate and stifle the DPRK, they noted.
					
					 In order to realize reconciliation, reunification and prosperity of the Korean nation all the pro-reunification patriotic forces supporting the June 15 joint declaration should go united to foil the reckless moves of the south Korean authorities for confrontation with the DPRK and implement the inter-Korean joint declarations without fail, they urged.
					
					 They appealed to all the Koreans of different strata in the U.S. to frustrate the moves of the anti-reunification conservative forces by their concerted efforts.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work off Press in France
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work off Press in France
 Pyongyang, January 31 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "On Preserving the Juche Character and National Character of the Revolution and Construction" was published in booklet by the Democrate Publishing House under the Anti-Imperialist Front of France on Jan. 25.
					 The work made public on June 19, Juche 86(1997) clarifies an idea that it is a basic principle for accomplishing socialism to preserve the Juche character and national character of the revolution and construction and tasks and ways for putting it into practice.
